metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9772 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient sanitisation in the OCaml compiler versions 4.04.0 and 4.04.1allows external code to be executed with raised privilege in binariesmarked as setuid, by setting the CAML_CPLUGINS, CAML_NATIVE_CPLUGINS, orCAML_BYTE_CPLUGINS environment variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocaml - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-base - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-base-nox - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-interp - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-mode - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-native-compilers - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-nox - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
ocaml-source - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ocaml package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.02.3-5ubuntu2').
